intro: Gomphocarpus lisianthoides, commonly known as the yellow moonviolet, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has hairy stems and leaves that are typically lance-shaped. Its fruit is a follicle that splits open to release seeds, a feature typical of the genus Gomphocarpus. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grassland or rocky habitats.
